meanings.definition: Convert or attempt to convert someone from one religion, belief, or opinion to another.
meanings.sent1: She proselytises her friends to try new foods.
meanings.sent2: The preacher proselytises to the community every Sunday.
meanings.sent3: He proselytises so passionately about his favorite sports team.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for gardening proselytises even the most reluctant to join in.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's dedication to education proselytises students to strive for success.

meanings.definition: Advocate or promote a particular cause or belief.
meanings.sent1: He proselytises for environmental conservation in his community.
meanings.sent2: The activist proselytises for equal rights for all.
meanings.sent3: She proselytises for the importance of daily exercise.
meanings.sent4: The author's book proselytises for the power of kindness in society.
meanings.sent5: Their campaign proselytises for the benefits of volunteering in the community.
